questions.question: Explain two Christian beliefs about the nature of God.
answer: First belief: Christians believe God is omnipotent (1) which means God is all-powerful and can do anything, as shown when God created the universe from nothing (1)
Second belief: Christians believe God is omnibenevolent (1) which means God is all-loving and shows perfect love to all creation, as demonstrated by sending Jesus to save humanity (1)
questions.explanation: This is a 4-mark question using 'Explain two' command word. Each belief needs a point (1 mark) plus development with 'because' or example (1 mark).

questions.question: Explain two ways Muslims show their devotion during Hajj.
answer: First way: Muslims perform Tawaf by walking seven times around the Kaaba (1) because this follows the example of Prophet Muhammad and shows submission to Allah (1)
Second way: Muslims throw stones at the pillars in Mina (1) because this symbolically rejects Satan and shows their commitment to following Allah's guidance (1)
questions.explanation: This is a 4-mark question requiring explanation and development of two ways Muslims show devotion.

questions.question: Explain two religious beliefs about marriage. Refer to sacred writings or another source of religious belief and teaching in your answer.
answer: First belief: Marriage is a sacred covenant blessed by God (1) because in Genesis it states that 'a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife' (1), showing marriage was part of God's plan from creation (1)
Second belief: Marriage should be permanent and indissoluble (1) as Jesus taught 'what God has joined together, let no one separate' (Mark 10:9) (1), meaning divorce goes against God's will (1)
questions.explanation: This is a 5-mark question requiring explicit reference to sacred writings. Each belief needs explanation with scriptural support.

questions.question: Explain two religious attitudes to abortion. Refer to sacred writings or another source of religious belief and teaching in your answer.
answer: First attitude: Some Christians oppose abortion in all circumstances (1) because they believe life begins at conception, and the commandment 'You shall not murder' (Exodus 20:13) (1) applies to unborn life as it is sacred to God (1)

Second attitude: Some religious believers accept abortion in extreme circumstances (1) following the principle of lesser evil, where saving the mother's life takes priority (1) as Islamic teaching permits abortion to save the mother's life (1)
questions.explanation: This is a 5-mark question requiring religious attitudes with reference to sources of authority and teaching.
